com.samsung.android.sdk.accessory

Class SAAgent

  • java.lang.Object
    • Service
      • com.samsung.android.sdk.accessory.SAAgent

  • public abstract class SAAgent
extends Service
    This class provides the main interface between Service Provider/Service Consumer applications and Samsung Accessory Service Framework. Both Service Provider and Service Consumer applications must derive from this class.

    Developer Guides

    This class provides the main interface for your application (acting as a Service Provider or Service Consumer), to interact with Samsung Accessory Service Framework. Both Service Provider and Service Consumer applications must declare a subclass of this class and implement the actions of an Accessory Peer Agent (Service Provider or Service Consumer).

    Your application must provide Accessory Service Profile information in an XML file (such as /res/xml/<profilename>.xml) and declare the path of the XML file in the AndroidManifest.xml file of your Android project as follows. 

     <meta-data android:name="AccessoryServicesLocation" android:value="/res/xml/<profilename>.xml"/>.

    In the Android Manifest file, your application must add the followings:

    Permission:
     <uses-permission android:name="com.samsung.accessory.permission.ACCESSORY_FRAMEWORK"/>
    Broadcast receivers:
      <receiver android:name = "com.samsung.android.sdk.accessory.ServiceConnectionIndicationBroadcastReceiver">
    <intent-filter>
      <action android:name="android.accessory.service.action.ACCESSORY_SERVICE_CONNECTION_IND"/>
    </intent-filter>
  </receiver>
  <receiver android:name = "com.samsung.android.sdk.accessory.RegisterUponInstallReceiver">          
    <intent-filter>
      <action android:name="android.accessory.device.action.REGISTER_AFTER_INSTALL"/>   
    </intent-filter>
  </receiver>

    The broadcast receiver is used to ensure that your Service Provider or Service Consumer application is notified when a remote Accessory Peer Agent requests a Service Connection with you. It also enables Samsung Accessory Service Framework to register your application automatically upon installation and advertise your Service Provider or Service Consumer application to others.

    The following example shows how the Accessory Service Profile specifications are structured in the XML file. 

      <resources>
    <application name = "@string/app_name">
      <serviceProfile
        serviceImpl="com.samsung.accessory.smartviewprovider.backend.GalleryProviderServiceImpl"
        role="provider"
        name="smartview" 
        id="/system/gallery"
        version="1.0"
        serviceLimit="any"
        serviceTimeout="10">
        <supportedTransports>
          <transport type="TRANSPORT_BT"/>
          <transport type="TRANSPORT_WIFI"/>
        </supportedTransports>
        <serviceChannel
          id="100"  
          dataRate = "high" 
          priority = "low" 
          reliability= "enable"/>
        </serviceProfile>
        <serviceProfile
          serviceImpl="com.samsung.accessory.msgprovider.backend.MessageProviderImpl"
          role="provider"
          name="message_service_provider" 
          id="/system/messages"
          version="1.0"
          serviceLimit="any">
        <supportedTransports>
          <transport type="TRANSPORT_BT"/>
          <transport type="TRANSPORT_WIFI"/>
        </supportedTransports>
        <serviceChannel
          id="902"  
          dataRate = "low" 
          priority = "low" 
          reliability= "disable"/>     
      </serviceProfile>       
    </application>
  </resources>

    The following elements and attributes are used:

    "application name": This attribute is the name that you want Samsung Accessory Service Framework to advertise in the Accessory eco-system. Usually the application's Android AppName is used. You can implement multiple Service Providers and/or Service Consumers in one application. In that case, declare multiple <serviceProfile> elements inside the <application> element.

    In each <serviceProfile> element,

    "serviceImpl": This attribute must be your subclass extending SAAgent .

    "role": This attribute must be "provider" or "consumer".

    "name" This attribute is the friendly name of you Service Provider or Service Consumer.

    "id": This attribute is the Service Profile ID of the Service Provider or Service Consumer.

    "version": This attribute specifies the Service Profile specification version that your Service Provider or Service Consumer implements.

    "serviceLimit": This attribute sets how many Accessory Peer Agents you want to be connected with concurrently.:If an Accessory Peer Agent requests a connection with your application after you have reached the limit, Samsung Accessory Service Framework rejects the connection request. The value can be:
    - one_peeragent : Supports only one Accessory Peer Agent.
    - one_accessory : Supports only one Accessory Device, but can have Service Connections to multiple Accessory Peer Agents on that Accessory Device.
    - any (default): Supports multiple Accessory Peer Agents on multiple Accessory Devices.

    "serviceTimeout": This attribute is optional. It controls the timeout for handling incoming Service Connection requests.The application can decide immediately whether to accept or reject an incoming Service Connection request. Or the decision can take longer, for example, if you need to connect to a cloud server, ask for user permission, or ask for authentication. If the application takes a long time to make the decision, set this value accordingly. If the application exceeds the timeout, the requesting Peer Agent gets the response stating that the connection failed because your application gave no response.

    <supportedTransports>: This element declares the transports that Service Provider or Service Consumer is able to operate on. Currently, Samsung Accessory Service Framework supports the TRANSPORT_WIFI, TRANSPORT_BT, TRANSPORT_BLE, and TRANSPORT_USB transport types. If your Service Provider or Service Consumer supports multiple transports, declare multiple <transport> elements.

    In each <serviceChannel> element:

    "dataRate": This attribute must be specified as either "low" or "high".

    "priority": This attribute must be specified as "low", "medium" or "high".

    "reliability": This attribute must be specified as "enable" or "disable". The attribute defines whether you want a reliable transfer. In case of a packet drop, a reliable transfer re-transmits the packet (but also creates additional overhead).

    To lower the chances of a registration failure, check /res/xml/<profilename>.xml file using the following Document Type Definition (DTD). If you develop with Eclipse IDE, copy theDTD rules to the top of the application's accessory XML file. Eclipse IDE usually validates the Serivce Profile XML against the DTD rules. Simply right-click on the XML file and click "Validate". To ensure that Eclipse IDE validates the profile XML file when you build the application, select the "Enable markup validation" check-box in Eclipse settings (Window-> Preferences->XML->XML Files->Validation). In addition, make sure that "No grammar specified" and "Missing root element" are set to "Ignore". 

      <!DOCTYPE resources [
  <!ELEMENT resources (application)>
  <!ELEMENT application (serviceProfile)+>
  <!ELEMENT supportedTransports (transport)+>
  <!ELEMENT serviceProfile (supportedTransports, serviceChannel+) >
  <!ELEMENT transport EMPTY> 
  <!ELEMENT serviceChannel EMPTY> 
  <!ATTLIST application name CDATA #REQUIRED>
  <!ATTLIST application xmlns:android CDATA #IMPLIED>
  <!ATTLIST serviceProfile xmlns:android CDATA #IMPLIED>
  <!ATTLIST serviceProfile serviceImpl CDATA #REQUIRED>
  <!ATTLIST serviceProfile role (provider | consumer) #REQUIRED>
  <!ATTLIST serviceProfile name CDATA #REQUIRED>
  <!ATTLIST serviceProfile id CDATA #REQUIRED>
  <!ATTLIST serviceProfile version CDATA #REQUIRED>
  <!ATTLIST serviceProfile serviceLimit (ANY | ONE_ACCESSORY | ONE_PEERAGENT | any | one_accessory | one_peeragent)  "ANY">
  <!ATTLIST serviceProfile serviceTimeout CDATA #IMPLIED>
  <!ATTLIST supportedTransports xmlns:android CDATA #IMPLIED>
  <!ATTLIST transport xmlns:android CDATA #IMPLIED>
  <!ATTLIST transport type (TRANSPORT_WIFI|TRANSPORT_BT|TRANSPORT_BLE|TRANSPORT_USB 
                              |transport_wifi|transport_bt|transport_ble|transport_usb) #REQUIRED>
  <!ATTLIST serviceChannel xmlns:android CDATA #IMPLIED>
  <!ATTLIST serviceChannel id CDATA #REQUIRED>
  <!ATTLIST serviceChannel dataRate (Low | High | low | high) #REQUIRED>
  <!ATTLIST serviceChannel priority (Low | Medium | High | low | medium | high) #REQUIRED>
  <!ATTLIST serviceChannel reliability (enable | disable 
                                      | ENABLE | DISABLE ) #REQUIRED>
  ]>

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int AUTHENTICATION_FAILURE_PEER_AGENT_UNREACHABLE
      Authentication request failed because the remote Accessory Peer Agent is unreachable.
      static int AUTHENTICATION_SUCCESS
      Authentication request succeeded.
      static int CONNECTION_ALREADY_EXIST
      New connection failed because a Service Connection with the remote Accessory Peer Agent already exists.
      static int CONNECTION_FAILURE_DEVICE_UNREACHABLE
      Connection failed because the remote Accessory Peer Agent is unreachable.
      static int CONNECTION_FAILURE_INVALID_PEERAGENT
      Connection failed because the SAPeerAgent input argument is null or invalid.
      static int CONNECTION_FAILURE_NETWORK
      Connection failed because of a network error.
      static int CONNECTION_FAILURE_PEERAGENT_NO_RESPONSE
      Connection failed because the remote Accessory Peer Agent gave no response.
      static int CONNECTION_FAILURE_PEERAGENT_REJECTED
      Connection failed because the remote Accessory Peer Agent rejected the request.
      static int CONNECTION_FAILURE_SERVICE_LIMIT_REACHED
      Connection failed because the service limit set by the Accessory Peer Agent has been reached.
      static int CONNECTION_SUCCESS
      Connection established successfully.
      static int ERROR_CONNECTION_INVALID_PARAM
      Connection failed because the data kept by Samsung Accessory Service Framework was lost.
      static int ERROR_FATAL
      Fatal error occurred.
      static int ERROR_SDK_NOT_INITIALIZED
      Accessory package is not initialized.
      static int FINDPEER_DEVICE_NOT_CONNECTED
      No Accessory Peer Agents were found because no Accessory Devices are connected.
      static int FINDPEER_DUPLICATE_REQUEST
      Previous findPeerAgents request still in progress.
      static int FINDPEER_SERVICE_NOT_FOUND
      No Accessory Peer Agents were found because no matching Accessory Peer Agents exist on connected Accessory Devices.
      static int PEER_AGENT_AVAILABLE
      Accessory Peer Agent is available on a remote Accessory Device.
      static int PEER_AGENT_FOUND
      Accessory Peer Agent was found.
      static int PEER_AGENT_UNAVAILABLE
      Accessory Peer Agent is unavailable on a remote Accessory Device.

        public static final int PEER_AGENT_FOUND
        Accessory Peer Agent was found. Result code of the onFindPeerAgentResponse(SAPeerAgent, int) callback.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • PEER_AGENT_AVAILABLE

        public static final int PEER_AGENT_AVAILABLE
        Accessory Peer Agent is available on a remote Accessory Device. Result code of the onPeerAgentUpdated(SAPeerAgent, int) callback.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • PEER_AGENT_UNAVAILABLE

        public static final int PEER_AGENT_UNAVAILABLE
        Accessory Peer Agent is unavailable on a remote Accessory Device. For example, the application package containing the Accessory Peer Agent was uninstalled on the remote Accessory Device. Result code passed in the onPeerAgentUpdated(SAPeerAgent, int) callback.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

        Constant Field Values

      • ERROR_CONNECTION_INVALID_PARAM

        public static final int ERROR_CONNECTION_INVALID_PARAM
        Connection failed because the data kept by Samsung Accessory Service Framework was lost. You can not recover from this error in runtime. User may need to reboot the device. Error code of onError(String, int).
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

        public static final int ERROR_FATAL

      • ERROR_SDK_NOT_INITIALIZED

        public static final int ERROR_SDK_NOT_INITIALIZED
        Accessory package is not initialized. All Service Provider and Service Consumer applications are expected to call SA.initialize(Context) to initialize the Accessory package before using it. Error code of onError(String, int).
        See Also:
